intro: Spodiopogon pilosus, commonly known as the hairy spikerush, is a perennial wetland plant native to North America. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and grass-like plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, cylindrical stems and dense, hairy foliage that gives it its common name. It typically grows in marshy areas and along the edges of ponds and streams. Spodiopogon pilosus plays an important role in wetland ecosystems by stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various aquatic organisms.
